graphics.opengl.core
Interface GLRenderableObject

All Known Implementing Classes:
Actor, Animation, GLBitmapFont, GLLetter, GLScreen, Sprite, Tile, TileMap
public interface GLRenderableObject

An interface used by anything that should be rendered using OpenGL.

Author:
John Barbero Unenge

Method Summary

          Get the bounds of the GLRenderableObject.

Method Detail

render

void render(Rectangle object,
            Rectangle target,
            javax.media.opengl.GLAutoDrawable canvas,
            float zIndex)
Render the GLRenderableObject.

Parameters:
object - The rectangle representing where the object should be drawn.
target - The rectangle representing the surface to draw to.
canvas - The canvas to draw to.

update

void update(double dt)
Updates the state of the GLRenderableObject.

Parameters:
dt - The time passed since last frame.

getBounds

Rectangle getBounds()
Get the bounds of the GLRenderableObject.

Returns:
The Rectangle representing the bounds.
